solution_line_template: If on the return journey to its home, the alligator took {extra_time_return} more hours than it took to travel to the Nile Delta, Paul took {time_to_delta}+{extra_time_return}=<<{time_to_delta}+{extra_time_return}={time_return}>>{time_return} hours to travel back to its home.
The total time Paul took to travel from its home to the Nile Delta and back is {time_return}+{time_to_delta}=<<{time_return}+{time_to_delta}={total_time_paul}>>{total_time_paul}

On his return journey, Paul traveled with six other alligators, and since each alligator traveled for six hours up the Nile to their home, they took a total of {other_alligators}*{time_return}=<<{other_alligators}*{time_return}={total_time_others}>>{total_time_others} hours to do so.

Together with Paul, all the alligators took {total_time_paul}+{total_time_others}=<<{total_time_paul}+{total_time_others}={combined_time}>>{combined_time} hours traveling between Nile Delta and up the Nile.
